p: The highest level of anthocyanins was found in mustard (405.52 µg/g), followed by broccoli (172.51 µg/g FW). The lowest levels, on the other hand, were detected in daikon and watercress (57.56 and 52.28 µg/g FW, respectively). Rocket salad (42.26 µg/g FW) showed the lowest anthocyanin concentration, which was statistically different from the other species.
